alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms associated with a cold front will impact portions of Weld, northern Morgan, northern Washington, Logan, eastern Larimer, Phillips and Sedgwick Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms developing ahead of an approaching cold front. The showers and storms extended along a line extending from around Nunn to near Fairfield, or along a line extending from 25 miles north of Greeley to 14 miles to near Holyoke. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail may accompany the stronger storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Visiblities across could drop to less than one half mile in blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Fort Collins, Greeley, Sterling, Holyoke, Julesburg, Loveland, Windsor, Evans, Wellington, Milliken, Eaton, Severance, Ault, Kersey, Haxtun, Pierce, Timnath, Nunn, Fleming and Ovid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Areas of blowing dust could reduce visibility to less than one half mile. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
